definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: The young man asked him to show how to operate that machine.
sentences.chinese: 把這年輕人帶上岸並指給他去勞務市場的路。

sentences.english: As a consequence, the majority of today's mothers are in the labor market.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一種結果，大多數現在的母親都在勞務市場工作。

sentences.english: Take the young man ashore with you and show him the way to the labour market.
sentences.chinese: 把這年輕人帶上岸並指給他去勞務市場的路。
